page.title: 04Employment in Carsington
page.content: Employment in the village was chiefly cocerned with lead mining until the early 1900's and Quarrying still continues nearby.Farming has seen the five farms within the village,each supporting at least one family fifty years ago reduced to just one farm worked by the farmer and his wife. Today only four people resident within the village actually gain employment from within the village these being the farmer and his wife, the local publican and the local shopkeeper.Many people now living in Carsington have reached retiring age but those that do work commute to nearby towns such as Ashbourne, Wirksworth and Matlock and to the city of Derby.
